Question: What should you do if you are driving and become sleepy?

Answers.Answer: Drive on the far left side of the road
Move off to the left of the road and have a rest
Speed up so that you can get home quickly
Keep on driving but use a lower gear

Question: When passing a bus displaying a School sign, that has stopped to let children on or off, what should your speed be?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What should you do if an ambulance comes up behind you, flashing red lights or sounding its siren?

Answers.Answer: Put your vehicle hazard lights on and drive on at the same speed
Slow down, pull over and allow the ambulance to pass
Flash your vehicle headlights to warn oncoming traffic

Who is responsible for making a child under 14 years use a seat belt or a safety seat in a vehicle?

Answers.Answer: With the front wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
With the rear wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
Where you can see all vehicles coming from all directions
Where you can only see vehicles coming from your right

Question: What is the speed limit from the time you pass an Accident sign until you are past the crash site?

Answers.Answer: pull to the side with the blowout
pull away from the side with the blowout

Question: What does a yellow reflector (cat's eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: Can you stop on a bus stop in a private motor vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Only if it is for less than 5 minutes

Question: You are driving in a 100km/h speed area and you see an Accident sign. What speed must you slow down to?

What must you do when turning right at a roundabout?

Answers.Answer: Not indicate at any time on the roundabout
Indicate left before entering the roundabout
Indicate right before entering the roundabout
Indicate right when leaving the roundabout

Question: Who may legally require you to give a blood sample?

Answers.Answer: A police officer, an ambulance officer, other crash party
A medical doctor, other crash party, a police officer
A police officer, a medical doctor or an approved person
An ambulance driver, an approved person or a medical doctor

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get out of the way

Question: What is the best way to check for hazards before reversing your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Relying only on the outside mirrors
Turning to look over your shoulders
Relying only on the inside mirrors
Walking around the vehicle before reversing

Question: When you have a learner licence you must always drive with a supervisor. A supervisor is a person who has held a current and valid licence for a year.

Answers.Answer: leave your keys in your vehicle
have someone stay with the vehicle who can move it
leave a note on the vehicle saying ‘Back soon’
will not be away from the vehicle for more than 5 minutes

if the driver has had any crashes
how many times the vehicle has crashed
that the vehicle was roadworthy at the time of checking

Answers.Answer: Others should give way to you

Answers.Answer: At such a speed that you can stop if you have to
